Detailed Description

MGPVertex is a parameter cell of the manifold dimension 0.

MGPVertex is a boundary of an Edge(start or end) to hold edge's parameter data. Logically PVertex has characters of both a parameter cell and a boundary. MGPVertex cannot be a binder cell, and so does not have partner cells. MGPvertex can be only partners of a binder. This is the reason that MGPVertex is a subclass of MGCellBase. Since MGPVertex's manifold dimension is 0, MGPVertex does not have boundaries.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MGPVertex* MGPVertex::clone (  )  const [virtual]

Make a clone of the cell.

int  line_density = 1

Implements MGObject.

MGCellNB* MGPVertex::make_binder (  )  const [virtual]

Make a binder cell of this parameter cell.

This is a parameter cell and the binder will be newed. Returned is the binder pointer generated. The binder has no geometry, only has binder and parameter cell relationship.

Implements MGCellBase.

MGPVertex& MGPVertex::operator= ( const MGGel &  gel2  )  [virtual]

Assignment.

does not change binder and partner relation. edge pointer will be cleared.

Reimplemented from MGGel.

MGPosition MGPVertex::pick_closest ( const MGStraight &  sl  )  const [inline, virtual]

Compute the parameter value of the closest point from the straight to this object.

sl is the eye projection line whose direction is from yon to hither, and if sl had multiple intersection points, The closest point to the eye will be selected. This will be never invoked.

Reimplemented from MGObject.
